com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.internal.blocks

Class BlockRenderProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.internal.blocks.BlockRenderProvider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FluidRenderingProvider, GrassRenderingProvider, RedstoneWireRenderingProvider

    public abstract class BlockRenderProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Lookup table for systems that handle additional block rendering options. When rendering actual real-world blocks, this method should be used to get that information. Some blocks are handled on the server-side, but blocks like Water lack this required information.

      • openResource

        public java.io.InputStream openResource(MapResourcePack.ResourceType type,
                                        java.lang.String path)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the resource (model json, png texture, etc.) at a particular path. This is called as a fallback when the resource is not found in the resource pack, while loading a model provided by this render provider.
        Parameters:
        type - of resource
        path - to get the resource at
        Returns:
        resource, null or exception if not found
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createModel

        public Model createModel(MapResourcePack resources,
                         BlockRenderOptions options)
        Creates the displayed Block Model for certain block render options
        Parameters:
        resources - from which model dependencies (textures, other models) can be loaded
        options - for rendering the block model
        Returns:
        block model, null if not available

      • addOptions

        public void addOptions(BlockRenderOptions options,
                       org.bukkit.World world,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int z)
        Adds options specific to the provider. world can be null when default render options are requested
        Parameters:
        options - to add to
        world - the block is at
        x - - coordinate of the Block
        y - - coordinate of the Block
        z - - coordinate of the Block
